page.title: 03Huw Cunnah's Farm.
page.content:
Living on a farm is a very interesting and busy life.We keep 127 Fresians and 115 calves.The cows are milked twice a day at 6.30a.m and 3.30p.m.They are fed on silage and cake while the calves have gruel-a mixture of water and protein.
In spring ,we plough the fields and sow barley, wheat and potatoes. On some fields we spread fertilizer so that the pasture can be cut twice for silage. This happens from May onwards.
At the end of August, we begin to harvest the wheat and barley, using our own combine harvester . We store the crops and use it to feed our livestock. In October we harvest the potatoes which we sell locally for 200p per 50Kg bag.
